means: 发出闪光( flash的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The words "Good Luck" were flashing on the screen.
sentence.Network_cn: “祝您好运”几个字出现在屏幕上。

sentence.Network_en: His mind kept flashing back to the previous night.
sentence.Network_cn: 他脑中不断回想起头天晚上发生的事。

sentence.Network_en: Some fog warning signs had been put up with flashing yellow lights.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些配有黄色闪光灯的大雾警示标志立了起来。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from the earlier synonym flash (of unknown origin) + -ing

entry.def: A flash is a sudden burst of light or of something shiny or bright.

example.ex: A sudden flash of lightning lit everything up for a second...
example.tran: 突然一个闪电瞬间照亮了一切。

example.ex: The wire snapped at the wall plug with a blue flash and the light fused...
example.tran: 墙上插头处的电线啪地发出一道蓝光，电灯的保险丝烧断了。

entry.def: If a light flashes or if you flash a light, it shines with a sudden bright light, especially as quick, regular flashes of light.

example.ex: Lightning flashed among the distant dark clouds...
example.tran: 一道道电光在远处的乌云中闪现。

example.ex: He lost his temper after a driver flashed her headlights as he overtook...
example.tran: 一个女司机在他超车时不停地闪着车前灯，这让他火冒三丈。

entry.def: You talk about a flash of something when you are saying that it happens very suddenly and unexpectedly.

example.ex: 'What did Moira tell you?' Liz demanded with a flash of anger...
example.tran: “莫伊拉跟你说什么啦？”利兹突然生气地质问道。

example.ex: When pursued, he made his escape with a flash of speed...
example.tran: 遭到追赶时，他突然飞速地逃脱了。

entry.def: If something flashes past or by, it moves past you so fast that you cannot see it properly.

example.ex: It was a busy road, cars flashed by every few minutes.
example.tran: 这是一条繁忙的道路，每隔几分钟就有汽车飞驰而过。

example.ex: ...the ball flashed across the face of the goal.
example.tran: 球从球门前飞过。

entry.def: If something flashes through or into your mind, you suddenly think about it.

example.ex: A ludicrous thought flashed through Harry's mind...
example.tran: 一个荒谬的念头突然在哈里脑中闪现。

example.ex: Those lines of Milton flashed into my mind.
example.tran: 弥尔顿的那几行诗忽然在我脑中闪过。

entry.def: If you flash something such as an identity card, you show it to people quickly and then put it away again.

example.ex: Halim flashed his official card, and managed to get hold of a soldier to guard the Land Rover.
example.tran: 哈利姆亮了一下他的军官证，设法找来了一名士兵看着路虎车。

entry.def: If a picture or message flashes up on a screen, or if you flash it onto a screen, it is displayed there briefly or suddenly, and often repeatedly.

example.ex: The figures flash up on the scoreboard...
example.tran: 数字显示在记分牌上。

example.ex: The words 'Good Luck' were flashing on the screen...
example.tran: “祝您好运”几个字出现在屏幕上。

entry.tran: (通过计算机、卫星或其他系统)快速发送，迅速播出，传送
entry.def: If you flash news or information to a place, you send it there quickly by computer, satellite, or other system.

example.ex: They had told their offices to flash the news as soon as it broke...
example.tran: 他们已经告诉各办公室，一有消息立即发布。

example.ex: This is, of course, international news and soon it was being flashed around the world.
example.tran: 当然，这是国际性新闻，很快就会传到世界各地。

entry.def: If you flash a look or a smile at someone, you suddenly look at them or smile at them.

example.ex: I flashed a look at Sue...
example.tran: 我向休瞥了一眼。

example.ex: Meg flashed Cissie a grateful smile.
example.tran: 梅格冲茜茜感激地笑了一笑。

entry.def: If someone's eyes flash, they suddenly show a strong emotion, especially anger.

example.ex: Her dark eyes flashed and she spoke rapidly.
example.tran: 她飞快地说着，黑色的双眼放着光。

entry.def: Flash is the use of special bulbs to give more light when taking a photograph.

example.ex: He was one of the first people to use high speed flash in bird photography.
example.tran: 他是最先使用高速闪光灯拍摄鸟类的人之一。

entry.def: A flash is the same as a flashlight .

example.ex: Stopping to rest, Pete shut off the flash.
example.tran: 皮特关掉手电筒，停下来休息。

entry.def: If you describe something as flash, you mean that it looks expensive, fashionable, and new.

example.ex: ...a flash uptown restaurant...
example.tran: 城郊富人区的豪华饭店

example.ex: You can go for a 'rostrum' system, which sounds flash, but can be assembled quite cheaply.
example.tran: 可以去弄一个“指挥台”系统，它听起来很昂贵，但其实花不了多少钱就可以组装起来。

entry.def: If you describe an achievement or success as a flash in the pan, you mean that it is unlikely to be repeated and is not an indication of future achievements or success.

example.ex: People will be looking in to see how good we are now and whether our success has just been a flash in the pan.
example.tran: 人们会来看看我们现在有多成功，看看我们的成功是否只是昙花一现。

entry.def: If you say that something happens in a flash, you mean that it happens suddenly and lasts only a very short time.

example.ex: The answer had come to him in a flash...
example.tran: 他一下子就有了答案。

example.ex: It was done in a flash.
example.tran: 一眨眼的工夫就完成了。

entry.def: If you say that someone reacts to something quick as a flash, you mean that they react to it extremely quickly.

example.ex: Quick as a flash, the man said, 'I have to, don't I?'
example.tran: 那人立即说道：“我必须如此，是不是？”

entry.tran: 突然记起;猛然想起;忽地记起
entry.def: If your mind flashes back to something in the past, you remember it or think of it briefly or suddenly.

example.ex: His mind kept flashing back to the previous night...
example.tran: 他脑中不断回想起头天晚上发生的事。

example.ex: Thoughts inevitably flash back to 1914, when trouble in this part of the Balkans led all the way to world war.
example.tran: 这难免会令人想起1914年，那年巴尔干半岛上这一地区的动荡最终引发了世界大战。

sentences.sentence: "a flash of emotion swept over him"
"the flashings of pain were a warning"

means.word_mean: 2. sheet metal shaped and attached to a roof for strength and weatherproofing
1. emitting light in sudden short or intermittent bursts;

auth_sentence.content: Her son is drawn in by the flashing lights.
auth_sentence.res_content: Her son is drawn in by the flashing lights.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Her son is drawn in by the flashing lights.

auth_sentence.content: Everyone is moving, gyrating, blinking, flashing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everyone is moving, gyrating, blinking, flashing.

auth_sentence.content: Leaks can occur if the flashing...becomes porous with age.
auth_sentence.res_content: Leaks can occur if the flashing...becomes porous with age.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Leaks can occur if the flashing...becomes porous with age.

Sentence.sentence: This meant of course that Doris had to tell Bass whether it was a flashing light or whether it was a steady light.
